definition: quilt wrapped around the body as a tube (traditional bedding)/(contemporary) bedding/quilt/blankets/cover/bed

quilt/by/(indicates passive-voice clauses)/(literary) to cover/to meet with/(coll.) (since c. 2009) used before a verb that does not accurately represent what actually happened, to describe with black humor how sb or sth was dealt with by the authorities (as in 被自殺|被自杀[bei4 zi4 sha1])
nest/pit or hollow on the human body/lair/den/place/to harbor or shelter/to hold in check/to bend/classifier for litters and broods
erhua variant of 被窩|被窝[bei4 wo1]

sentences.english: By ten thirty, he had already got between the sheets.
sentences.chinese: 到十点半时他已钻进被窝睡觉了。

sentences.english: Getting out of bed in the morning was like stepping into a meat locker.
sentences.chinese: 早上钻出被窝像是进了冷藏柜。

sentences.english: You need a warm bed and a bottle of hot water .
sentences.chinese: 你需要一个温暖的被窝和一瓶热水。

sentences.english: One had coins attached with red strings and was put at the foot of children's beds.
sentences.chinese: 一种红包是系有红线的硬币，放在孩子的被窝里。

sentences.english: He took out the screws, got rid of the hardware, and climbed into bed.
sentences.chinese: 他拧下螺丝，卸掉零件，就爬进了被窝。

sentences.english: On cold nights Munchie jumps upsintosmy bed and crawls under the covers.
sentences.chinese: 在寒冷的夜晚，麦奇会跳上我的床，钻进我的被窝。

sentences.english: You drag the family out of bed at 2AM to watch a lunar eclipse.
sentences.chinese: 你会在凌晨2点把全家从被窝里拽出来看月食。

sentences.english: We climbed back into bed together, and lay there discussing the night's events.
sentences.chinese: 我们一起爬进了被窝，躺在床上讨论这个晚上的事情。

sentences.english: I laugh in the sun during the day, crying in bed at night.
sentences.chinese: 我白天在阳光下欢笑，夜晚在被窝里哭泣。

sentences.english: On cold nights Munchie jumps up into my bed and crawls under the covers.
sentences.chinese: 在寒冷的夜晚，麦奇会跳上我的床，钻进我的被窝。

sentences.english: He’d got under the duvet, hoping his movements would wake her.
sentences.chinese: 他缩回被窝里并希望自己的这些动作能够吵醒她。

sentences.english: Pressing down the alarm-clock, he curled up for a last warm minute.
sentences.chinese: 按下闹钟，他蜷在暖和的被窝里再赖一会。

sentences.english: Night wind whistled, sleeping in bed, warm blanket is difficult to fall asleep.
sentences.chinese: 夜里寒风呼啸，睡在床上，暖暖的被窝却难以入睡。

sentences.english: But the next day he took a thick cloth, soaked it in water and spread it over the king's face, so that he died.
sentences.chinese: 次日，哈薛拿被窝浸在水中，蒙住王的脸，王就死了。

definition: erhua variant of 被窩|被窝[bei4 wo1]
quilt/CL:床[chuang2]
to go to bed/to sleep
to have a lie-in/to dawdle in bed
warm/nice and warm
nice and warm/cozy/heartwarming
to go to bed/(coll.) to have sex
to sleep in
to get into/to dig into (studies, job etc)/to squeeze into
comforter/quilt/CL:條|条[tiao2],面[mian4]
nice and warm
to get out of bed/to get up
nest/pit or hollow on the human body/lair/den/place/to harbor or shelter/to hold in check/to bend/classifier for litters and broods
to enclose/to cover with the hand (one's eyes, nose or ears)/to cover up (an affair)/contrary/to contradict
central heating/heater/warm air
to fall asleep
